item.title: Lecture 1 - Introduction to Semiconductors
item.description: Lecture presentation with an introduction to semiconductors, doping, generation/recombination, TE carrier concentrations, carrier dynamics, transport, and drift.

item.title: Lecture 10 - MOS Caps II; MOSFETs I
item.description: Lecture presentation on the three-terminal MOS capacitor, MOSFETs, and gradual channel approximation (GCA) using DA and ignoring subthreshold carriers.

item.title: Lecture 11 - MOSFETs II; Large Signal Models
item.description: Lecture presentation on a complete GC/DA model for iDS, saturation, channel length modulation, output characteristics, and regions of operation.

item.title: Lecture 12 - Sub-threshold MOSFET Operation
item.description: Lecture presentation on subthreshold operation of MOSFETs, development of the model, comparison to full numerical solution, and comparing and contrasting with BJTs.

item.title: Lecture 13 - Linear Equivalent Circuits
item.description: Lecture presentation on linear equivalent circuits for MOSFETs and BJTs at low and high frequency, and transconductance of subthreshold MOSFETs.

item.title: Lecture 14 - Digital Circuits: Inverter Basics
item.description: Lecture presentation on logic inverter basics, introduction to CMOS, transfer characteristics, noise margins, and optimal device sizing.

item.title: Lecture 15 - Digital Circuits: CMOS
item.description: Lecture notes on CMOS analysis, switching delays, power dissipation, and speed/power trade-offs.

item.title: Lecture 16 - CMOS scaling; The Roadmap
item.description: Lecture presentation on CMOS analysis, subthreshold leakage, and scaling rules.

item.title: Lecture 17 - Linear Amplifier Basics; Biasing
item.description: Lecture presentation on linear amplifier basics, performance metrics, current source biasing, current mirrors, mid-band range, and two-port representation.

item.title: Lecture 18 - Single Transistor Amplifier Stages
item.description: Lecture presentation on single-transistor building block stages, and common-source, common-gate, and common-drain (follower) stages.

item.title: Lecture 19 - Differential Amplifier Stages
item.description: Lecture presentation on differential amplifiers, large signal transfer characteristics, and small signal analysis using common- and difference-mode inputs.

item.title: Lecture 2 - Uniform Excitation; Non-uniform conditions
item.description: Lecture presentation on excess populations and minimum carrier lifetime, photoconductivity, non-uniform concentrations and diffusion, and Fick’s first and second laws.

item.title: Lecture 20 - Diff-Amp Anal. I: Metrics, Max. Gain
item.description: Lecture presentation on multi-stage amplifiers, cascading differential stages, current source biasing, output stages, performance metrics, nonlinear loads, and active loads.

item.title: Lecture 21 - Diff-Amp Anal. II: Output Stages
item.description: Lecture presentation on multi-stage amplifiers, active loads, biasing for maximum gain, input, and output swings.

item.title: Lecture 22 - Diff-Amp Anal. III: Cascode, µA-741
item.description: Lecture presentation on multi-stage amplifiers,, stage selection, speciality stages, looking at a commercial op-amp schematic, and frequency response.

item.title: Lecture 23 - Circuits at High Frequencies
item.description: Lecture presentation on frequency response of CS amplifiers, the Miller effect, intrinsic frequency limitations of MOSFETs, biasing to maximize speed, and power trade-off.

item.title: Lecture 24 - Intrin. Freq. Limits
item.description: Lecture presentation on the OCTC method for estimating frequency response, subthreshold amplifiers for ultra-lower power electronics, and frequency performance.

item.title: Lecture 25 - Beyond Si; Beyond 6.012
item.description: Lecture presentation on sub-threshold circuits, MOSFETs, BJTs, LEDs, and solar cells.

item.title: Lecture 3 - Solving The Five Equations
item.description: Lecture presentation on the five basic equations, device structures in TE, carriers and electrostatic potential, the 60 mV rule, and Poisson’s equation (PE).

item.title: Lecture 4 - p-n Junctions: Electrostatics
item.description: Lecture presentation on p-n junctions in thermal equilibrium and under reverse bias, the depletion approximation (DA), and comparison to PE solution.

item.title: Lecture 5 - p-n Junction Injection and Flow
item.description: Lecture presentation on reverse biased junctions, forward bias, and the special case of minority carrier injection into quasineutral regions.

item.title: Lecture 6 - p-n Junctions: I-V Relationship
item.description: Lecture presentation on forward biased p-n junctions, carrier injection, I-V characteristics (ideal and real; forward and reverse), and engineering carrier injection.

item.title: Lecture 7 - Bipolar Junction Transistors
item.description: Lecture presentation on bipolar junction transistors, two coupled diodes, terminal characteristics, and regions of operation.

item.title: Lecture 8 - BJTs Wrap-up, Solar Cells, LEDs
item.description: Lecture presentation on solar cells and LEDs (light emitting diodes).

item.title: Lecture 9 - MOS Capacitors I
item.description: Lecture presentation on MOS capacitors, the DA applied to two-terminal MOS capacitor accumulation, depletion, inversion, VFB, VT, QA, and QN.
